alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 3:32AM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 to 40 mph. * WHERE...In Kansas, Phillips County. In Nebraska, Franklin County. * WHEN...From late Sunday evening through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most hazardous conditions are currently forecast to occur from late Monday morning into Monday night due to the combination of at least moderate snow rates and increasing northerly wind gusts, resulting in blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
